intro: Hieracium laxifurcans, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Hieracium laxifurcans is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun.
